pages.text: Archaeology is the science (read: art) of digging up things and finding the story behind them. Have you ever dug out a block of dirt and wondered 'Aside from dirt, what else is this block made out of?' The sad truth is: it's always been there, only recently have we found the technology to allow us to examine our earth for finer materials, artifacts, and clues to the very nature of our world.

In our journey to understand our past, you will uncover fantastic artifacts with ancient powers, technological marvels of simpler times, and possibly even terrible knowledge.$(br2)...I'm getting ahead of myself. Let's start with something small! Find yourself a sedimentary deposit - look around for a rich spot in the ground and scoop it out with a shovel, to start.

Dirt and sand which lay on the surface of our world are naturally easy to spot, and their granular nature allows them to swallow up trinkets with ease - you won't find much of particularly old age within them, but it's a good place to start.$(br2)You must use a shovel to harvest piles of sedimentary debris.
